column4: Hiyo... I'm installing ubuntu on a box that has no network.  Is there a way I can download a bunch of packages to a CD to use instead ofa repo?
if another computer has ubuntu on it you could copy the contents of /var/cache/apt/archive to this computer?  just install/update everything you need on the ubuntu with network connection
gaming in ubuntu is kinda limited compared to Windows.  There are games, but not nearly as many.  if they're a gamer, you experiment probably will fail - or that's my hypothesis
you will love the linux permissions on files when copying to ntfs - but if that's not an issue, it *should* be fine.
don't do "partial" upgrades.  it will break things.
use "sudo aptitude safe-upgrade" from cli instead
Where does the lock file live?
partital upgrade = the only time i use aptitude
Do you know where the apt/upgrade manager lock file is?
not really - could you reboot?  if one locked up?
I could reboot, I guess, would that clean up the lock file?
add /etc/default/grub set GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash" and update grub
I think it depends on the hardware.  On mine, it's always eth1.
